summary:
Standard Glass IPO allotment status: How to check details online via KFin Tech, NSE & BSE; Check latest GMP

The Standard Glass IPO allotment status is announced, following a significant subscription rate. Investors can check their allotment status via KFin Technologies and stock exchanges.

  • The allotment is expected to be declared on January 9, with a subscription rate of 183 times.
  • The price band for the shares was Rs 133-140 each.
  • The IPO raised Rs 410.05 crore and received bids for over 381 crore shares.
  • Investors can verify their allotment status on the registrar's website and on NSE and BSE.

Infosys files counterclaim against Cognizant, accuses CEO Ravi Kumar of misusing sensitive information,... - Moneycontrol
summary:
Infosys Accuses Cognizant of Anticompetitive Practices in Counterclaim

Date: January 10, 2025 Source: Moneycontrol

India’s second largest software exporter, Infosys, has filed a counterclaim against Cognizant, alleging that the company indulged in anticompetitive tactics to hinder the growth of its healthcare platform, Infosys Helix.

  • Infosys filed the counterclaim on January 10, 2025, in a US Court.
  • The lawsuit arises amid a backdrop of allegations from Cognizant’s subsidiary that Infosys stole trade secrets.
  • Infosys is requesting a jury trial and seeks to invalidate Cognizant’s Non-Disclosure Agreements.
  • The counterclaim includes a request for triple damages and attorney's fees.
“We will vigorously defend the lawsuit in court.”

This counterclaim highlights the competitive tensions in the IT sector at a time of economic uncertainty.
newTitle: Infosys Accuses Cognizant of Anticompetitive Practices in Counterclaim

title: Tata Shocks Maruti Dzire & Honda Amaze With This New Feature! - MotorOctane
summary:
Tata Shocks Maruti Dzire & Honda Amaze With This New Feature!

Publication Date: Recent updates
Source: MotorOctane

Tata recently announced updates to its most affordable cars, introducing new features that may challenge competitors like Maruti and Honda.

  • The Tigor receives exterior design updates and interior tech enhancements.
  • New features on the Tigor include a 10.25-inch touchscreen, wireless connectivity, and a 360-degree camera.
  • The Tiago also benefits from similar updates but lacks some features like the 360-degree camera.
  • The price hike for the Tigor ranges from Rs 6.90 lakh to Rs 9.77 lakh, while the Tiago is priced between Rs 5.73 lakh and Rs 8.40 lakh.
"The new Tigor and Tiago are aimed at enhancing the value proposition for customers in the affordable segment."

The enhancements in Tata's models demonstrate the brand's commitment to staying competitive in a crowded market.
newTitle: Tata Enhances Affordable Car Lineup with New Features Ahead of Auto Expo

title: Big Four consultancies ask employees to go slow on work travel, use public transport - Moneycontrol
summary:
Big Four consultancies ask employees to go slow on work travel, use public transport

Date: January 10, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Big Four consultancies have implemented measures to limit work-related travel, encouraging employees to utilize virtual meetings and public transportation to reduce costs and support sustainability goals.

  • Employees are encouraged to minimize travel for client visits.
  • When travel is necessary, public transport is recommended.
  • These directives have been issued in the past few months in response to carbon footprint targets.
  • Recent client engagements have seen fewer employees traveling, advocating for remote coordination instead.
“But the firm took a view that it was sufficient for one partner to travel, and the rest could be coordinated online.”

This move reflects the consultancies' commitment to environmental responsibility while balancing operational effectiveness.
newTitle: Big Four Consultancies Encourage Employees to Limit Travel and Use Public Transport

title: Bonus Share 2025: ANNOUNCEMENT on Jan 13; multibagger stock up 460% in 2 years - ET Now
summary:
Bonus Share 2025: Announcement on Jan 13; Multibagger Stock Up 460% in 2 Years

Updated Jan 10, 2025 | Source: ET NOW News

A multibagger stock, Anand Rathi Wealth Ltd., which has delivered a whopping 460% return in the past two years, is set to announce a bonus issue on January 13.

  • The company is meeting to consider its first-ever bonus issue.
  • Bonus shares make stocks more appealing to retail investors and show financial strength.
  • As of January 10, Anand Rathi shares rose 6.35% to Rs 4,193.05.
  • The stock has a market cap of Rs 17,311 crore and a 52-week high of Rs 4,640.55.
"The Board of Directors in its meeting inter-alia would also consider a proposal for Issuance of Bonus Shares to the shareholders of the Company," - Anand Rathi Wealth Ltd.

This announcement may encourage more investment and rewards current shareholders, reflecting the company's growth and stability.

title: Vodafone Increases Stake in Vi to 24.39 Percent After Completing Share Placing in Indus - TelecomTalk
summary:
Vodafone Boosts Stake in Vi to 24.39% with Indus Towers Share Placing

Publication Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: Telecom Talk

Vodafone Group Plc announced it has increased its stake in Vodafone Idea Limited (Vi) following a financial transaction involving Indus Towers that secured Vodafone's obligations.

  • Vodafone invested Rs 19.1 billion to raise its stake in Vi to 24.39 percent.
  • Rs 8.9 billion was allocated to repay borrowings and transaction fees.
  • The funds enabled Vi to settle its Master Service Agreement dues with Indus Towers.
"Vi have used the proceeds from this Capital Raise to pay outstanding Master Service Agreement (MSA) dues to Indus. Following this, Vodafone's obligations to Indus under the Security Arrangements have now been satisfied in full," Vodafone stated.

This strategic move allows Vodafone to enhance its stake in the competitive telecom market while fulfilling financial commitments to Indus Towers.
newTitle: Vodafone Boosts Stake in Vi to 24.39% with Indus Towers Share Placing

title: Tata Steel, SAIL, Coal India among others hit 52-week low in weak market today, check full list - Upstox
summary:
Tata Steel, SAIL, Coal India Among Stocks Hitting 52-Week Low in Weak Market

Date: January 10, 2024

Source: Not specified

Benchmark indices witnessed losses mainly in banks, energy, and FMCG stocks despite an initial rise, with IT stocks remaining resilient.

  • Tata Elxsi Ltd hit a 52-week low of ₹5,921 after an 8% decline.
  • Tata Steel Ltd fell to ₹126.70, down 2.5%, marking a third consecutive session of decline.
  • Steel Authority of India Ltd (SAIL) dropped to ₹104.80, with concerns over entering a trading ban.
  • Coal India Ltd shares fell 2% to ₹364.70 amidst collaborations for critical minerals.
  • Additional stocks hitting 52-week lows include Bajaj Housing Finance, IRCTC, and Yes Bank among others.
“The cautious approach among investors is impacting market sentiment due to global economic uncertainties.”

The downturn in the market is attributed to global factors and declining performances of major stocks.

title: Defence stock Apollo Micro Systems declares preferential issue at ₹114 per share. Details here | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Apollo Micro Systems Announces Preferential Issue at ₹114 per Share

Date: 09 January 2025 Source: Live Mint

Apollo Micro Systems has declared the issuance of a preferential issue at ₹114 per share to raise funds, aiming to increase its paid-up capital.

  • The company plans to raise its paid-up capital from ₹36 crores to ₹45 crores.
  • Out of the additional ₹9 crores, ₹3.34 crores will be raised through preferential shares.
  • The issuance will consist of up to 3,34,18,806 equity shares at a price of ₹114 each.
  • The funds will be allocated to a select group of investors outside the promoter group.
“The Authorized capital of Apollo Micro Systems has been increased from ₹36 crores to ₹45 crores,” the company stated.

This preferential issue signifies Apollo Micro Systems' efforts to enhance its financial standing and support future growth.
newTitle: Apollo Micro Systems Announces Preferential Issue at ₹114 per Share

title: Supreme Court stays GST proceedings against online gaming companies on Centre’s request - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Stays GST Proceedings Against Online Gaming Companies

Published on: 10 Jan 2025, 7:07 am

The Supreme Court has stayed Goods and Services Tax (GST) proceedings against 49 online gaming companies which were facing retrospective demands for taxes based on the full face value of bets placed through their platforms.

  • The stay was granted on the request of the GST department and the case is set for hearing on March 18.
  • The GST Council had imposed a 28% tax on the full face value of online gaming bets effective from October 1, 2023.
  • Online gaming companies argue that this tax method is unfair and advocate for a tax based on gross gaming revenue instead.
  • As of December 2023, 71 show-cause notices alleging GST evasion totaling ₹1.12 lakh crore were issued to online gaming companies.
  • The total liability could exceed ₹2.3 lakh crore, including interest, due to severe penalties associated with these notices.
“The ruling dealt a significant blow to the GST department, which appealed the decision directly to the Supreme Court.”

This decision represents a critical juncture in defining the tax obligations of online gaming platforms and could impact their future operations significantly.
newTitle: Supreme Court Stays GST Proceedings Against Online Gaming Companies

title: Stock Market Live: Nifty, Sensex Flat As Surge In IT Stocks Offset Decline In Financials, Pharma, Energy - NDTV Profit
summary:
Stock Market Today: Sensex and Nifty End Week With 2% Decline

Publication Date: January 10, 2025

Source: Bloomberg Quint

Indian equities saw gains and losses but closed lower for the second consecutive session as financial, pharma, and energy stocks weighed. Gains in information technology stocks helped offset the wider decline. The NSE Nifty 50 ended 95 points or 0.4% lower, while the BSE Sensex lost 241.3 points or 0.31%.

  • Nifty declined as much as 0.78% to an intraday low of 23,503.
  • Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) was the top gainer on the Nifty, rising 5.6% after impressive earnings.
  • PSU banks and overall broader markets underperformed.
  • The US futures declined leading into jobs data.

The rupee weakened to a record low of 85.95 against the US dollar, indicating ongoing concerns about currency stability.

This week's performance shows a significant decline in broader indices, indicating a trend that investors should keep an eye on.
newTitle: Stock Market Today: Sensex and Nifty End Week With 2% Decline

title: Harsh Goenka weighs on L&T chairman's '90-hour work-week' remark, says 'work-life balance isn’t... - Moneycontrol
Harsh Goenka weighs on L&T chairman's '90-hour work-week' remark, says 'work-life balance isn’t... - Moneycontrol
IREDA Profit Soars, Shares Dip - Indiainfoline
Decoding India’s growth slowdown - The Hindu
summary:
Decoding India’s growth slowdown

Published: January 10, 2025 08:30 am IST

Source: The Hindu

The first advance estimate of India’s GDP for 2024-25 reveals a decline in real GDP growth rate to 6.4% from 8.2% in 2023-24, which challenges previous projections. Concerns are raised regarding potential underestimation of the GDP growth rate as discrepancies in data collection methods are highlighted.

  • India's GDP growth rate projected to decline significantly in 2024-25.
  • Concerns about the reliability of official GDP estimates due to data collection issues.
  • Private sector investment is not responding positively to government tax cuts, affecting overall economic growth.
  • Public spending remains crucial in sustaining economic growth amidst a slowdown.
  • The economic slowdown risks disrupting the Union Budget's fiscal targets.
“A reworking of the revenue mobilisation strategy is required to enhance capex and welfare spending.”

The analysis indicates the need for structural changes and improved data reliability to accurately reflect the economic landscape.
newTitle: Understanding India's Economic Growth Slowdown

title: SC stays GST show cause notices to online gaming companies; Delta Corp, Nazara Tech shares surge up to 7% - Moneycontrol
summary:
SC stays GST show cause notices to online gaming companies; Delta Corp, Nazara Tech shares surge up to 7%

Date: January 10, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Supreme Court has stayed the GST show cause notices amounting to Rs 1.12 lakh crore to online gaming companies, causing shares of Delta Corp and Nazara Tech to surge.

  • Supreme Court stayed all proceedings until the case is resolved, with a final hearing scheduled for March 18.
  • Delta Corp shares rose over 4% while Nazara Tech shares saw a modest decline.
  • The apex court's decision halts significant financial pressures on the online gaming sector.
“All further proceedings shall remain stayed till the case is decided,” said the apex court.

This ruling is significant for the online gaming industry and could shape future regulations.
newTitle: Supreme Court Halts GST Notices to Online Gaming Firms, Shares Surge

title: Delta Corp, Nazara Tech shares surge over 15% after big relief from Supreme Court - CNBCTV18
summary:
Delta Corp, Nazara Tech shares surge over 15% after big relief from Supreme Court

Date: January 10, 2025 Source: CNBC TV18

The Supreme Court provided relief to online gaming companies by staying GST show cause notices worth ₹1.12 lakh crore, resulting in a significant uptick in stock prices for Delta Corp and Nazara Tech.

  • Delta Corp shares surged by 14%, while Nazara Tech shares increased by 7% after the news broke.
  • The stock gains were fueled by concerns over possible coercive actions by tax authorities.
  • The court ruling has stayed all further proceedings under the challenged GST notices until a final decision is made.
  • The larger tax demand from the DGGI against 71 gaming companies could total ₹2.3 lakh crore including penalties.
  • Shares cooled off from initial highs, with Delta Corp trading 4.5% higher later in the day.
"The Supreme Court has directed that all further proceedings under the show cause notice will remain stayed till the case is finally decided."

The court's intervention indicates ongoing legal challenges within the gaming industry, highlighting the significance of regulatory clarity for market participants.
newTitle: Delta Corp and Nazara Tech Shares Surge After Supreme Court Relief

The Tata Nexon has been updated for 2025 with new colour options and variants, starting from Rs 8 lakh (ex-showroom).

  • Three new variants introduced: Pure Plus, Creative, and Creative Plus PS.

title: “Enough To Devastate Every U.S Navy Warship At Norfolk”: China’s “Shadow Fleet” Raises Alarm In Washington - EurAsian Times
summary:
China's 'Shadow Fleet' Raises Alarm in Washington

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: EurAsian Times

The U.S. has blacklisted China's largest shipping company, Cosco Shipping Holdings Co., along with major shipbuilders for their alleged ties to the People’s Liberation Army (PLA), escalating geopolitical tensions.

  • Cosco Shipping is now listed on the U.S. Federal Register blacklist.
  • This blacklisting extends to major players in tech and energy sectors in China.
  • Past sanctions on Cosco included penalties for transporting Iranian oil.
  • The blacklisting serves as a deterrent to U.S. businesses from engaging with these companies.
  • Concerns are raised about China’s use of merchant ships to support military operations, namely the civil-military fusion strategy.
  • A notable incident involved the COSCO Sakura ship docking near the Norfolk Naval Station.
  • Experts warn about the potential of using commercial vessels for military logistics.
  • China's maritime militia strategy is drawing significant attention and concern.
“If only, say, 10% of those containers were used for munitions, they could, for example, field 144 cruise missiles and 252 quadcopters, more than enough to devastate every warship at Norfolk...” - Thomas Shugart

This situation highlights the implications of China's military shipping strategies and the ongoing U.S.-China maritime competition.
newTitle: China's 'Shadow Fleet' Raises Alarm in Washington

title: Big Bucks: L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan who wants 90-hr workweek earns ₹51cr—whopping 535x more than average employee! | Today News - Mint
summary:
L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan Earns ₹51 Crore, Advocates 90-Hour Workweek

Date: January 9, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

Larsen & Toubro (L&T) Chairman SN Subrahmanyan is under scrutiny for advocating a 90-hour workweek while earning ₹51 crore a year, 535 times more than the average employee salary.

  • Subrahmanyan's total earnings for 2023-24 include a base salary of ₹3.6 crore, perks worth ₹1.67 crore, commission of ₹35.28 crore, and retirement benefits of ₹10.5 crore.
  • The median salary of L&T employees is ₹9.55 lakh.
  • L&T issued a clarification on Subrahmanyan’s statement, stating it reflected a vision for extraordinary outcomes through hard work.
  • Public reactions highlight concerns over work-life balance and the high demands of such work expectations.
“Let your young employees enjoy family life. Family life and leisure time is as important as work life and money.” — Dr. Poornima

L&T's remarks indicate a commitment to national progress while raising questions about employee welfare amidst high executive compensation.
newTitle: L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan Earns ₹51 Crore, Advocates 90-Hour Workweek

title: Kalyan Jewellers shares decline for sixth consecutive day - Moneycontrol
summary:
Kalyan Jewellers Shares Decline for Sixth Consecutive Day

Date: January 10, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Kalyan Jewellers India Ltd. shares have fallen for the sixth consecutive day, with a decline of 3.34 percent on January 10, trading at Rs 651.45. The company recently announced a potential net revenue growth of 39% for Q3 FY25.

  • Shares fell 3.34% on January 10.
  • Current trading price: Rs 651.45.
  • Net revenue expected to grow by 39%.
  • India business surge reported at 41% due to festive and wedding demand.
  • Same-store-sales growth recorded at 24%.
  • 24 new Kalyan showrooms were launched in the previous quarter.
  • Plans to open 30 more Kalyan showrooms and 15 Candere showrooms this quarter.
“The quarter also witnessed growth in same-store-sales, close to 24 percent.”

The ongoing decline in share prices prompts a closer look at the company's performance amidst strong revenue growth projections.
newTitle: Kalyan Jewellers Shares Decline for Sixth Consecutive Day

title: IREDA Q3FY25 net profit jumps 27% YoY to ₹425 crore; shares trade lower - Upstox
summary:
IREDA Q3FY25 net profit jumps 27% YoY to ₹425 crore; shares trade lower

Publication Date: N/A

Source: N/A

IREDA has reported a significant increase in net profit and revenue from operations for the third quarter of FY25, indicating strong growth in the renewable energy sector.

  • Revenue from operations rose 36% YoY to ₹1,698 crore.
  • Net profit jumped 27% YoY to ₹426 crore.
  • Non-fossil fuel capacity increased to 200 GW, aiming for 500 GW by 2030.
  • Operating income increased by 51% YoY to ₹652 crore.
  • GNPA improved to 2.68% from 2.90% YoY.
  • Loan book expanded to ₹68,960 crore from ₹50,580 crore YoY.
  • Shares recorded nearly 5% negative returns for Q3FY25, although they more than doubled in 2024.
"The renewable energy sector witnessed strong growth..."

The results reflect IREDA's strong performance amidst challenges in share prices, showcasing the resilience of the renewable energy sector.
newTitle: IREDA Reports 27% YoY Net Profit Increase for Q3FY25 Despite Share Decline

Tata Motors has introduced model year updates for its entry-level models, Tiago, Tiago EV, and Tigor, enhancing their features and adjusting pricing.

title: Adani Wilmar shares crash 9% as promoter looks to sell up to 20% stake via OFS - Moneycontrol
Adani Wilmar shares slide 9% as promoter looks to divest 20% stake via OFS | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Adani Wilmar Shares Drop 9% as Promoter Plans to Divest 20% Stake

Date: January 10, 2025 Source: Live Mint

Adani Wilmar's shares plummeted by 9.5% following the announcement of a plan by its promoter to divest up to 20% stake through an Offer For Sale (OFS).

  • The promoter, Adani Commodities LLP, will sell up to 17,54,56,612 equity shares, representing 13.5% of the company's total equity.
  • The OFS begins for non-retail investors on January 10 and for retail investors on January 13.
  • Adani Enterprises plans to exit its joint venture stake in Adani Wilmar, affecting the company's shareholding structure.
  • The company's revenue saw a 33% YoY increase in Q3 FY25, despite challenges in the market.
“The value of Adani Enterprises' current stake in Adani Wilmar is estimated at ₹18,500 crore, equivalent to over $2 billion.”

The stock's decline and the ongoing divestment plan highlight significant market shifts and challenges ahead for Adani Wilmar.
newTitle: Adani Wilmar Shares Drop 9% as Promoter Plans to Divest 20% Stake
